intro: Cephaelis albiflora, commonly known as white-flowered cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Cephaelis albiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
